repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Fixes #4137

Also adds a check whether we have the GIL before doing so. This
is important because Py_UNBLOCK_THREADS is documented as unsafe
if we don't hold the GIL. This bit of it is possibly a candidate to be
backported (since the pattern was allowed in Cython 0.29 but
can cause a segfault).

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2347,15 +2347,25 @@ def put_acquire_gil(self, variable=None):
         self.putln("__Pyx_FastGIL_Forget();")
         if variable:
             self.putln('_save = %s;' % variable)
+        if unknown_gil_state:
+            self.putln("if (_save) {")
         self.putln("Py_BLOCK_THREADS")
+        if unknown_gil_state:
+            self.putln("}")
         self.putln("#endif")
 
-    def put_release_gil(self, variable=None):
+    def put_release_gil(self, variable=None, unknown_gil_state=True):
         "Release the GIL, corresponds to `put_acquire_gil`."
         self.use_fast_gil_utility_code()
         self.putln("#ifdef WITH_THREAD")
-        self.putln("PyThreadState *_save;")
+        self.putln("PyThreadState *_save = NULL;")
+        if unknown_gil_state:
+            # we don't *know* that we don't have the GIL (since we may be inside a nogil function,
+            # and Py_UNBLOCK_THREADS

comment_data.body: This was only added in Py3.4. Guess we'd have to emulate it in P2.7.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2347,15 +2347,25 @@ def put_acquire_gil(self, variable=None):
         self.putln("__Pyx_FastGIL_Forget();")
         if variable:
             self.putln('_save = %s;' % variable)
+        if unknown_gil_state:
+            self.putln("if (_save) {")
         self.putln("Py_BLOCK_THREADS")
+        if unknown_gil_state:
+            self.putln("}")
         self.putln("#endif")
 
-    def put_release_gil(self, variable=None):
+    def put_release_gil(self, variable=None, unknown_gil_state=True):
         "Release the GIL, corresponds to `put_acquire_gil`."
         self.use_fast_gil_utility_code()
         self.putln("#ifdef WITH_THREAD")
-        self.putln("PyThreadState *_save;")
+        self.putln("PyThreadState *_save = NULL;")
+        if unknown_gil_state:
+            # we don't *know* that we don't have the GIL (since we may be inside a nogil function,
+            # and Py_UNBLOCK_THREADS
+            self.putln("if (PyGILState_Check()) {")

comment_data.body:
Hmmmm... thinking about it more this is at least slightly dodgy, because it will end up with the GIL held even if it wasn't originally. It'll kind of work, and it doesn't seem to crash, but it's not really right.

@mattip do you know any better way of implementing this on PyPy2?

(just to be clear since this confused me at first: PyPy supports this on python3.6+). I guess PyPy could backport the support for this function to PyPy2. The logic is pretty deep inside PyPy's implementation so I can't think of any other way to do this for PyPy.

We should always keep the order of "special case(s), then default case". Otherwise, if we need to add another special case, we'll have to reverse all the code here. (I'm sure I'm guilty of not doing this consistently either…)
Added to PyPy2, this will be part of the next release (v7.3.6, probably in October).

Thanks. I've looked at it more and decided that "return 0" is probably a fairly safe fallback - in this case it'll just result it in keeping hold of the GIL which is unlikely to be a disaster.

So I've updated the comment, added a PyPy version-check, and abused "deprecated" attributes to give a warning message for users to ignore. Which I think are all reasonable.

I'd give them at least a version. It seems confusing and backwards to get a *deprecation* warning for something that is essentially a bug which was already resolved in a future version.
```suggestion
    #if defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201402L
        [[deprecated("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2 < 7.3.6")]]
    #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__clang__)
        __attribute__ ((__deprecated__("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2 < 7.3.6")))
    #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
        __declspec(deprecated("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2 < 7.3.6"))
    #endif
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -636,6 +636,32 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE void * PyThread_tss_get(Py_tss_t *key) {
 // PyThread_ReInitTLS() is a no-op
 #endif /* TSS (Thread Specific Storage) API */
 
+
+#if PY_MAJOR_VERSION < 3
+#if (CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_PYPY && PYPY_VERSION_NUM < 0x07030600)
+    #if defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201402L
+        [[deprecated("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2")]]
+    #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__clang__)
+        __attribute__ ((__deprecated__("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2")))
+    #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
+        __declspec(deprecated("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2"))
+    #endif

comment_data.body: OTOH, if the comment is correct, and we're actually not releasing the GIL when users ask for it, then this seems a regression, right?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -636,6 +636,32 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE void * PyThread_tss_get(Py_tss_t *key) {
 // PyThread_ReInitTLS() is a no-op
 #endif /* TSS (Thread Specific Storage) API */
 
+
+#if PY_MAJOR_VERSION < 3
+#if (CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_PYPY && PYPY_VERSION_NUM < 0x07030600)
+    #if defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201402L
+        [[deprecated("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2")]]
+    #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__clang__)
+        __attribute__ ((__deprecated__("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2")))
+    #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
+        __declspec(deprecated("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2"))
+    #endif

comment_data.body:
Sort of. The problem is that (at least on CPython and probably PyPy) it's a hard crash to try to release the GIL when we don't hold it.

It's currently allowed in Cython 0.29 (but will crash if the GIL isn't held) but blocked in 3.0.alpha. So it isn't a regression compared to the current master.

It also only applies to a `with nogil` block in a `nogil` function. Most of the time it knows it has the GIL so skips the check
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -636,6 +636,32 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE void * PyThread_tss_get(Py_tss_t *key) {
 // PyThread_ReInitTLS() is a no-op
 #endif /* TSS (Thread Specific Storage) API */
 
+
+#if PY_MAJOR_VERSION < 3
+#if (CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_PYPY && PYPY_VERSION_NUM < 0x07030600)
+    #if defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201402L
+        [[deprecated("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2")]]
+    #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__clang__)
+        __attribute__ ((__deprecated__("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2")))
+    #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
+        __declspec(deprecated("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2"))
+    #endif

comment_data.body: I think this is right in the most up-to-date version

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -636,6 +636,32 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE void * PyThread_tss_get(Py_tss_t *key) {
 // PyThread_ReInitTLS() is a no-op
 #endif /* TSS (Thread Specific Storage) API */
 
+
+#if PY_MAJOR_VERSION < 3
+#if (CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_PYPY && PYPY_VERSION_NUM < 0x07030600)
+    #if defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201402L
+        [[deprecated("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2 < 7.3.6")]]
+    #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__clang__)
+        __attribute__ ((__deprecated__("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2 < 7.3.6")))
+    #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
+        __declspec(deprecated("`with nogil:` inside a nogil function will not release the GIL in PyPy2 < 7.3.6"))
+    #endif
+    static CYTHON_INLINE int PyGILState_Check(void) {
+        // PyGILState_Check is used to decided whether to release the GIL when we don't
+        // know what we have it. For PyPy2 it isn't possible to check.
+        // Therefore assume that we don't have the GIL (which causes us not to release it,
+        // but is "safe")
+        return 0;
+    }

commit.message:
Allow releasing gil in nogil functions

Fixes #4137

Also adds a check whether we have the GIL before doing so. This
is important because Py_UNBLOCK_THREADS is documented as unsave
if we don't hold the GIL. This bit of it is possibly a candidate to be
backported (since the pattern was allowed in Cython 0.29 but
the behaviour looks like it could be quite buggy).

Added "get gil in nogil function" test-case

It worked as-is, but it's still worth explicitly testing

title: Allow releasing gil in nogil functions
